title: cmd/gc: use of ideal float const as slice/array index should be permitted
body:
by **fred@torbit.com**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Define a constant with a floating-point literal (1.0, 1e9)
2. Use it to index a slice

example: http://play.golang.org/p/1j2Glx10dI

What is the expected output?
It should compile.

What do you see instead?
Compiler errors:
prog.go:7: non-integer array index d
prog.go:8: non-integer array index e

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
Linux Mint 14

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version devel +46db2dd7ba7c Wed Feb 06 00:33:25 2013 +0800 linux/amd64
